extendedIngredients.name: fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.original: ½ cup finely diced fennel bulb
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup finely diced fennel bulb

extendedIngredients.name: oil packed sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: ½ Tablespoon oil from sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ Tablespoon oil from sun dried tomatoes

extendedIngredients.name: oil packed sun dried tomatoes
extendedIngredients.original: 2 Tablespoons chopped sun dried tomatoes in olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 Tablespoons chopped sun dried tomatoes in olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalName: chopped sun dried tomatoes in olive oil

extendedIngredients.name: oyster mushrooms
extendedIngredients.original: 1 generous cup sliced mushrooms – you favorite variety; I used a blend including oyster, porcini, baby portabellas, etc.
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 generous cup sliced mushrooms – you favorite variety; I used a blend including oyster, porcini, baby portabellas, etc.
extendedIngredients.originalName: generous cup sliced mushrooms – you favorite variety; I used a blend including oyster, porcini, baby portabellas, etc.

extendedIngredients.name: Whole Grain Teff Flour
extendedIngredients.original: ½ cup whole grain teff (I use Bob's Red Mill Whole Grain Teff.)
extendedIngredients.originalString: ½ cup whole grain teff (I use Bob's Red Mill Whole Grain Teff.)
extendedIngredients.originalName: whole grain teff (I use Bob's Red Mill Whole Grain Teff.)

title: Healthy Gluten Free Teff Polenta with Tomato Mushroom Topping
instructions: Bring water and salt to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan.Add teff, fennel and herbs; stir and return to boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.Cook 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until teff thickens.While teff cooks, add both types of tomatoes and oil to a small saucepan, bring to a boil and cover. Reduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes. Turn off heat and add mushrooms.Give a gentle stir, then cover the pot to let the mushrooms steam and keep the mixture warm.To serve, portion the teff polenta into serving bowls and top each portion with a generous ladle of tomato-mushroom topping.Garnish with a sprig of fennel frond, and if you are not dairy-free, perhaps you’ll enjoy adding a few shavings of parmesan cheese.

steps.step: Bring water and salt to a boil in a 2-quart saucepan.

Add teff, fennel and herbs; stir and return to boil, then reduce heat to low and cover.Cook 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until teff thickens.While teff cooks, add both types of tomatoes and oil to a small saucepan, bring to a boil and cover. Reduce heat to low and simmer 15 minutes. Turn off heat and add mushrooms.Give a gentle stir, then cover the pot to let the mushrooms steam and keep the mixture warm.To serve, portion the teff polenta into serving bowls and top each portion with a generous ladle of tomato-mushroom topping.
Garnish with a sprig of fennel frond, and if you are not dairy-free, perhaps you’ll enjoy adding a few shavings of parmesan cheese.
